She is the in hospital right now.  They thought she might have some heart damage - looks like it is just the cancer in the liver doing it's thing.  Anyway, I told her I would come back with your feed back on the Naveline tomorrow.  Please let me know if you have ever been on it ..... Posts.Content: liz35 wrote: Has anyone ever had Neumega for a low platelet count?  My mom's count is getting a little lower after every chemo.  It is still bouncing back, however I am worried at some point it will not.  Her doctor said the only thing they could do would be a transfusion, however I came across the drug Neumega that said it was for low platelets.  Has anyone ever heard of this or used it? Good luck with your scans! Liz

Posts.Title: MOM WITH METS IN LUNGS, BONES, BRAIN AND NOW LIVER EXAIMA sdurantmd

Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2008 04:23AM liz35 wrote: Lanef, I know just how you feel.  My mom has not been doing well for the last two months.  She has missed chemo the last two weeks due to low blood counts.  Been in and out of the ER and hospital.  She is also young to me, just 63.  I have ALL the same feelings you have.  It is very hard when you have a family of your own to take care of also.  I finally had to break down and go seem my doctor for a little "chemical" help.  I put it off and off - but the last couple of months have been so hard I needed some balance.  She put me on a very low dose of Lexapro (sp).  I can still cry and what not - but it helps me to deal with the feeling I had inside of me that would never go away.  I'm not saying it is for everyone - but it has helped me.  I'm still sad and I HATE to see my mom like this, but I know she needs me to be at my best and I was having a very hard time doing that.   I really hope your mom can come back from this.  This is the hardest thing I have ever had to deal with as I am sure it is for you.  It SUCKS!!!!!!! If you ever need to talk - I know where you are coming from. Liz
Posts.Title: Could use some prayers & positive energy please! LANEF debstitchestoo

Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2008 10:45PM liz35 wrote: Stephanie - I only come back to this site every now and then now that my mom has passed.  And I don't post anymore ... but I just wanted to say SCREW him!  Sorry, but that is the first thing that came into my head. Big Hug! Liz
Posts.Title: My Neighbor's Son Laughed at Me TripleNeg AliceJean

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2008 05:05AM liz35 wrote: Janis~ I am so happy to hear you are doing journals for your kids!  Although I am grown with kids of my own, everyday I wish my mom had left something like that for me.  I wish more then anything she was still here with us, but to have something special like that would have meant SO much! To all you ladies that are on this road and have kids, young or old, please consider making letters, journals or video tapes for your family.  When you leave us, we still have to go on with our lives - and it is hard, so hard.  To have this piece of you will help so much.

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2008 09:38PM liz35 wrote: Hi Bonnie~ My mom has done two months of Gemzar.  The first month she missed week three due to low blood count AND week one of month two.  Thankfully her numbers came up and she was able to do three weeks in a row after that.  She feels a little nausea for about 24 -36 hours then she is just tired - most of the time really.  This is her week off and she is still pretty run down.   Good luck to you - I have heard a lot of pople say Gemzar has done great things for them!!!!!!! Liz

Posts.Content: Mar 29, 2008 01:52PM liz35 wrote: Ask about other pain meds.  My mom is on morphine SR ( slow release ) which works well for her.  She tried the liquid stuff but it made her sick also.  Her onc says the most important thing is that she is not in pain - just give them a call.  They should be more then willing to help.
Posts.Title: my mom and chemo ejohn liz35

Posts.Content: liz35 wrote: Hi Ladies~ Has anyone who has been on Gemzar had to do it every other week due to low blood counts??  My mom is on her third round of Gemzar and is missing yet another treatment today.  This is the third one she has had to miss.  She did get all three last month but she had to put it off for a week.  Anyway, her doc said they could do it every other week if need be.  She will have her first set of scans at the end of round three to see if it is working - she's triple neg with mets to the liver dx July 18th 2007.  She does have liver pain for a few days after treatment then it goes away so I am thinking that could be a good thing.  Killing off those life sucking buggers I hope! Hope this post was not to scattered.  You ladies are so great.  I have been trying to get my mom to come to this site but she's not really there yet I guess.  I told her I would stop lurking  if she joined - but until then there is to much information to be learned from all of you - it's a blessing to have found you.  Thank you!
